If checked the system will track and update the time remaining on any active light sources.

How frequently tracked light sources will be updated, in seconds.
If checked the Light Tracking interface will open on startup (GM only).

If checked the Realtime Light Tracking will pause whenever Foundry is paused.

Controls if players can see remaining time left on light sources.
SHADOWDARK.settings.use_clockwise_initia: If checked the combatant with the highest initiative roll will go first, and all other combatants will follow in a fixed order. All NPCs will be grouped together in the initiative order.
SHADOWDARK.settings.use_2d10.hint: Rolls will be made with 2d10 and summing up the results, instead of 1d20. Advantage and disadvantage are rolled with 3d10 and keeping either the 2 higher or 2 lower results.
SHADOWDARK.settings.use_2d10.name: Roll 2d10 instead of 1d20
SHADOWDARK.settings.use_coreSpellcasting: Uses the original Core Rules for Spellcasting. If unselected, the Core Spellcasting tabs will be hidden from character sheets.
SHADOWDARK.settings.use_seiriziaSpellcas: Use the magic of Seirizia, nano-mages, aura-mages and metal-mages.
SHADOWDARK.settings.use_britannianRuneMa: Use the rules for Britannian Rune Magic.
SHADOWDARK.settings.use_pulp_mode.hint: Shows Luck tokens as a numeric value rather than a checkbox
SHADOWDARK.settings.use_pulp_mode.name: Enable Pulp Mode

SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.an_tooltip: This word is used to either negate or banish targets, or even reverse the meaning of another word. For instance, a Fire attack could be cast as 'Kal Flam', whereas a cold attack can be cast as 'Kal An Flam'. A counterspell can be 'An Ort', and an 'awakening' spell can be 'An Zu'. An area of darkness, for example, can be created with 'In An Lor Grav'. 'An' can be used to banish creatures as well, either sending them away from the mage, such as in 'An Xen', or banishing a summoned creature with 'An Kal Xen'.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.bet_tooltip: This word covers small targets or creatures. 'Bet' can be used by itself to mean insects and rodents without the need for a 'Bet Xen'. This word can be used to decrease a character's size, shrinking it to halfway its size. Shrunk characters suffer STR -2, CON -1, AC +1, and both its HP and damage dealt are halved. As with every spell that lasts for more than a moment, these spells require the use of the 'In' word, otherwise, characters will shrink for a moment and then return to their original size. This word can also transform a target into a small animal, down to a mouse.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.corp_tooltip: This word can be used to cause death, corroding one's tissues from within, summon or banish undead, or even reverse death itself. If used to increase a spell's damage, the added damage is 1d6 higher. When creating undead, the word's circle depends on the target's level. Each circle level allows the mage to raise an undead of that same level. The mage can either raise one, very powerful undead, or a group of undead whose combined levels equals the word's circle. You can only have one summoned, created or raised creature at your command at any given time. Resurrection is an 8th circle spell. A character can only be the target of a resurrection once. Resurrection is usually 'In Mani Corp', for a final 10th circle spell. A fearful use of this word is the spell that instantly kills a target. The 'Corp' Circle for this effect is 8. The death spell is usually 'Corp Por'. If a target is killed by a death spell, they can be easily revived by a dispel ('An Ort'), but the DC for this dispel increases by 1 for each day after which the target has been dead. 'Corp' is also associated with fear and panic with 'Quas Corp'.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.des_tooltip: This word is used to refer to the downwards direction, as well as any sort of decreasing effect. It could use to transport a target to a floor below on a building (or a dungeon), or it could be used to reduce a target's strength, or perception, etc. Spells that diminish a target's capabilities can either diminish a stat modifier by 1, or grant a -1 penalty to a specific type of action (an attack) or even to AC.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.ex_tooltip: This word can be translated as 'a target's ability to act or be acted upon'. 'Ex' can be used to lock doors or chests ('An Ex Por'), or to unlock these same objects ('In Ex Por'), it could be used to paralyze an enemy ('An Ex Por') or to increase its mobility ('In Ex Por'). When reducing one's mobility, this word can cut a target's move by half.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.flam_tooltip: This word contemplates any effect related to fire, but also ice and water (with 'An Flam').
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.grav_tooltip: This word means 'energy', but also 'field'. It can be used to create spells related to lightning, but also any spell that influences a physical area. Creating zones of fire, ice, poison or sleep are effects achieved with this word (with 'In Flam Grav', 'In An Flam Grav', 'In Nox Grav' or 'In Zu Grav'). This word turns an effect into a 3-hex area effect that can take place in Near range. 'An Grav' can also dispel magical area effects.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.hur_tooltip: This word is used to affect wind, air and weather. Weather spells have a differentiated area of effect of one horizon: they affect the entire horizon as visible by the mage at the time of casting. The circle for a weather controlling spell depends on the phenomena being created or dispelling. The strength of the effect created or dispelled depends on the word increases. A weather spell lasts for its natural duration. Mages can create and dispel the phenomenon, and can control its general direction, but cannot control it so much it as to make lightning fall exactly where they want it.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.in_tooltip: This is the word to create effects that bring about lasting changes. 'In' must be used to increase the duration of a spell from 'Focus' to '1 hour'. It can also increase its range from 'Close' to 'Near', or from 'Near' to 'Far'. When increasing the duration of a damage-dealing or healing spell, each increase adds 1 turn to the spell's duration. Damage-dealing spells cannot be permanent.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.jux_tooltip: This word is related to direct harm to targets. It can be used to create magical attacks ('Ort Jux' is a known combination for a magic missile), but it can also be used to affect other effects that harm targets ('An Jux', for instance, can counter other attack spells). When Jux is used, the spell's damage increases by 1d6. 'Jux' is also required for creating direct attacks.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.kal_tooltip: This word is mostly used as the first word in attack spells ('Kal Flam' is a classic firebolt), and can sometimes be used interchangeably with 'In'. However, 'Kal' can also be used in summoning magical creatures. When used for summons, 'Kal' can be used just like 'In' in regards to extending the duration of spells. If you use 'In Kal', you can create spells that last for a day. When Kal is used on an attack spell, the spell's damage increases by 1d6. Summoned creatures can be of a level as high as the word's circle.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.lor_tooltip: This word covers every effect involving light, or the lack thereof (such as invisibility or darkness spells). There's a rules exception for 'Lor': If used to create a source of light, this spell always has a fixed duration of 1 real world hour. 'In An Lor' is a classic invisibility spell. It requires 2 'Lor' circles. Any invisibility spell ends when the target takes any form of offensive action.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.mani_tooltip: This word can recover hit points, diseases, illnesses or intoxication. At its most extreme form, it can even bring back the dead. When casting a healing spell, the base healing is 4 hit points. Healing spells are usually instantaneous. If the mage uses 'Mani' to perform physical treatment other than to heal hit points, such as granting immunity to poison, creating magical nourishment or healing a disease, these effects need a duration.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.nox_tooltip: With this word, the mage can create effects related to biological toxins in general. This word increases a spell's damage by 1d6. When dealing poison damage to a target, the mage has the option of splitting the damage across several turns. For instance, instead of dealing one '2d6' poison damage, they could split this into two '1d6' damages across 2 turns. Poison has no effect on constructs, undead, demons and elementals.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.ort_tooltip: This is the word that deals with magic itself. It is a very versatile word that can be used for magical analysis, attacks, metamagics in general, and even pure magical attacks. Magical analysis and identification are usually performed with 'Wis Ort'. When facing an ongoing magical effect, mages can use 'Ort' to attempt to identify its presence. This spellcasting check must overcome the check of the spell being identified. This identification is instantaneous, and can be done in an action while in combat. Characters only get one such chance to identify a spell. Detailed analysis of an ongoing spell is a more demanding activity, requiring 1 hour of casting. On a success, the character learns which spell is in progress and what are its parameters. If the test is made on a magical object, the character also learns how to activate or deactivate it. As with identifications, characters only get one chance to analyze a spell or item.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.por_tooltip: This word is used to create and control the movement of targets, creating many 'telekinetic' effects as well as teleportations. 'Por' spells can be used to allow mages to use their skills at a distance, for instance, picking a lock without touching it, pushing a distant lever and so on. To move an inanimate object, this word allows 1 kg of inanimate object to be moved at 1 m/s. For heavier targets, each increase doubles the weight. For faster movement, each increase doubles the speed. To levitate living beings, the word allows a living being weighing 80 kg to levitate at 1 m/s. For heavier targets, each increase doubles the sustained weight. For faster movement, each circle increase doubles the speed. If the target requires support from an external object (such as a carpet or broom), you get one increase for free. Teleportation spells can transport a target instantaneously to another place in the mage's line of sight. For an increase, the mage can open a portal between the two points that's big enough for most humanoids to pass through. Teleportation to an unseen location can only be performed if the mage has a left 'teleport mark' on the target place. A 'teleport mark' is a 'Kal Por Ylem' spell, that marks a place as a possible teleport destination. Further teleport spells can target that location no matter how far away the mage is (as long as it's in the same plane of existence). A 'Recall' teleportation is a 'Kal Ort Por' spell, that can be turned into a gate for a 'Por' increase. There are certain 'independent' teleport marks on the world to which the mage can always teleport, even without having created a mark himself. These are usually known as 'moongate' locations.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.quas_tooltip: This is the word for illusion, but also for a target's perceptions.'Illusion' doesn't only apply to a physical, external illusion, but also to mental illusions. Thus, 'Quas' can be used to alter and sometimes control a target's mind. A famous charming spell that causes targets to see allies as enemies and vice-versa is 'Quas An Wis'. The size of an image created with 'Quas' is that of a human being (2x1x1 meters). One increase turns it into a 3-hex area, and two increases turn this into a 5-hex area. For an increase, you can create illusions that also have a component of solidity, with 1 hit point, that can be touched and that interact with the world around them. If the illusion requires self-initiative, use 'Wis'.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.rel_tooltip: This word is used to transform a target. Metamorphosis spells fall under this word, as well as spells that alter a target's natural disposition.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.sanct_tooltip: This word is used to create many forms of protection as well as undo them (with 'An Sanct'). It can be used to increase a character's hit points, AC, protect or weaken them against magic, and even lock or unlock chests. This word enhances a target's hit points by 5 per increase. It can also enhance their AC by 1 per increase.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.tym_tooltip: This word allows a mage to control the passage of time. It does have an overlap with 'Por', as it can create instantaneous movement, something that looks like a teleport. This word can grant a target one, and only one additional action on a combat turn. This requires 2 increases. This word cannot stop or reverse the flow of time.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.uus_tooltip: This word is used to refer to the upwards direction, as well as any sort of improvement effect. It could use to transport a target to a floor above on a building (or a dungeon), or it could be used to increase a target's strength, or perception, etc. Spells that enhances a target's capabilities can either enhance a stat modifier by 1, or grant a +1 bonus to a specific type of action (such as an attack) or even to AC.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.vas_tooltip: This word is used to improve the effects of other spells. When used with attack spells, they double the damage dealt. When used with healing, they double the recovered hit points. This word can also increase a spell's duration. A 'Focus' spell becomes '1 hour', a '1 hour' becomes '1 day', and a '1 day' spell becomes permanent. A mage can only maintain one permanent spell at a time. This word also doubles all other numerical attributes of a spell. For instance, a 'Rel Por' 3rd circle telekinesis spell can move a 1 kg object up to 2 m/s. A 4th circle 'Vas Rel Por' spell could move a 2 kg target up to 4 m/s. If this word is compounded on itself, each increase will not multiply the last increase by two, instead, they enhance the multiplier itself by 1. For instance, while basic 'Vas' doubles a spell's effect, 'Vas' with one increase would triple it, and 'Vas' with 2 increases would quadruple it.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.wis_tooltip: This is the word for knowledge and information. It can be used to create clairvoyance spells, mind reading, see through walls or even cast mental attacks. When creating magical attacks with Wis, these are direct attacks resisted with the target's WIS. Damage caused by this word is 1d6 per increase.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.xen_tooltip: This word is used to affect 'creatures' in general. This means, basically, any living thing other than the mage. Many spells don't need to use this word. A healing spell, for instance, can be cast with 'In Mani', there's no need for 'In Mani Xen'. 'Xen' is fundamentally necessary when the mage wants to create or control creatures, or transform a target into a creature or part of one. This could even be used to transform one person into another. This word can be used to grant targets abilities found on other animals. To completely transform the target into an animal, or part thereof, the final level of the animal must be equal to or lower than the word's circle. The same rule apply for summonings. You can only have one summoned, created or raised creature at your command at any given time. The mage can also transform part of the target's body into something else.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.ylem_tooltip: This word covers any solid, inanimate target. Earth, stone, rock, and any object in general. This word is only necessary when the caster wants to transform the internal nature of a target, or cause a massive change. A telekinesis spell, for instance, can be cast as 'Rel Por', it doesn't need 'Rel Por Ylem'. However, to summon an earth elemental, the caster needs 'Kal Xen Ylem', because without 'Ylem' the 'Xen' word would only affect a living, organic creature. No magical transformation with this word is permanent unless the spell is cast as a permanent spell. Matter transformation using this word has a circle that depends on the substance being affected.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_rune.zu_tooltip: The final word in the runic alphabet affects sleep and dreams. It can be used to knock out opponents in combat, awaken sleeping targets, or enter their own dreams.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.radioInt: Radio Interface: Can communicate up to {100}m with other radio interfaces.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.muscleRe: Muscle Reinforcement: Increases STR by {1} (up to 20).
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.cardiacS: Cardiac Support: Increases CON by {1} (up to 20).
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.reflexBy: Reflex Bypass: Increases DEX by {1} (up to 20).
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.muscleOx: Muscle Oxygenation: Gains advantage on STR checks.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.artifici: Artificial Blood Filtering: Gains advantage on CON checks.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.secondar: Secondary Reflex-Arcs: Gains advantage on DEX checks.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.speedBoo: Speed Boost: +{1} to melee damage rolls.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.tracking: Tracking Interface: Choose one opponent per turn. This opponent gets -{1} to AC against the mage's attacks.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.quantumE: Quantum-Effect Nano-Grapplers: The mage can climb walls and ceilings.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.skinFilt: Skin Filtering: Can breathe through the skin (even underwater)
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.legMuscl: Leg Muscle Augment: Can jump {2}x high, {2}x far.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.organRei: Organ Reinforcement: Can fall from any height and take no damage.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.immuneSy: Immune System Boost: Always stabilizes upon reaching 0 HP.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.secondar: Secondary Memory Search: Gets advantage on any INT check.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.microExp: Micro-Expressions Readout: Gets advantage on any CHA check.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.moralNeu: Moral Neural Network: Gets advantage on any WIS check.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.augmente: Augmented Sensorial Gain: Gets advantage on Perception checks.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.threatPr: Threat Prediction: DEX bonus to AC increases by {1}.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.suppress: Suppress Weariness: Can move {1} more hex per turn.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.improved: Improved Optical Processing: Can see {2}x further. Grants +{1} to ranged attacks. Advantage on checks dealing with sight.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.chameleo: Chameleon Skin: +{1} to Stealth Checks if not wearing clothes.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.bloodFil: Blood Filtering: Advantage on resistance against poisons or toxins.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.skinDeOx: Skin De-Oxygenation: Takes only half fire damage (round down).
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.internal: Internal Heating: Takes only half cold damage (round down).
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.electrom: Electromagnetic Subdermal Mesh: Takes only half lightning damage (round down).
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.gammaFil: Gamma Filtering: Takes only half radiation damage.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.hyperspe: Hyperspectral Vibration Analyzer: Advantage on checks dealing with sounds.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.heuristi: Heuristic Nose Filter: Advantage on checks dealing with scents.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.nanoSigh: Nano-Sight: Can see other nano-clouds (if there's enough lighting).
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.adaptive: Adaptive Tracking System: Choose {1} opponent{s} per combat. Advantage on attack rolls against this opponent.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.neuralNe: Neural Net Prediction: Choose one opponent per turn. +{1} to AC against this opponent.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.muscleOv: Muscle Overcharge: Once per turn, gains a free attack against an opponent that attacks you in close range.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_internal.electrom: Electromagnetic Mesh: Gains {1} temporary hit point{s}. This effect can only be cast once per day.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.radioClo: Radio Cloud: The cloud can communicate up to {100}m with other radio interfaces.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.stinging: Stinging Cloud: Deals {1} point{s} of damage once to anything in the area.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.corrosiv: Corrosive Cloud: Deals {1} point{s} of damage per turn to anything in the area.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.burningC: Burning Cloud: All flammable objects catch fire.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.staticCl: Static Cloud: Any target with anything metallic takes {2} points of lightning damage once.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.hyperSta: Hyper Static Cloud: Any target with anything metallic takes {2} points of lightning damage per turn.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.antiNano: Anti-Nano Cloud: Another nano-cloud takes {1} point{s} of damage, once.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.nullNano: Null-Nano Cloud: Another nano-cloud takes {1} point{s} of damage per turn.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.nanoBuff: Nano-Buffer: Prevents {1} point{s} of damage by another nano-cloud.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.dustGath: Dust Gatherer: Reduces Visibility in the area. -{1} to all physical actions.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.darkFogE: Dark Fog Engine: Completely impedes visibility in the area.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.flameBur: Flame Burst: The cloud bursts with {1}d6 fire damage per turn, once.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.targetAn: Target Analyzer: Warns the caster if any particular target enters or leaves the cloud. Also, analyzes target's DNAs and identifies technological objects.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.imagePro: Image Projection: The cloud projects a visual image determined by the caster (i.e., a visual illusion). Cannot be used to create a light source.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.substanc: Substance Projection: The cloud projects a visual image with tactile response, as determined by the caster. Cannot be used to create a light source.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.ethereal: Ethereal Speakers: The cloud projects a sound as determined by the caster.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.nanoBoom: Nano-Boom: The cloud emits a loud thunder that dazes anyone nearby, once. 'CON' check against {12} to avoid being dizzy for 1d6 turns. Dizzy characters get disadvantage on physical checks.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.stunning: Stunning Burst: The cloud emits a loud thunder that stuns anyone nearby, once. 'CON' check against {10} to avoid being stunned for a turn. Each turn they get a new check to snap out. Stunned characters cannot act.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.remoteSe: Remote Sensing: The mage can see, or hear, or touch, or even speak through the nano-cloud (or any combination of these senses). This program also includes a 100m radio interface.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.attricti: Attriction Coating: Every surface in the nano-clouds's area increases its attriction rate. Moving through each hex costs {2} points.
SHADOWDARK.nano_effect_external.antiAttr: Anti-Attriction Coating: Every surface in the nano-clouds's area increases gets slippery. Everyone moving through it must roll DEX vs {12} or fall down.
SHADOWDARK.nano_dizzyOneTurn: Dizzy for a turn (-2 to physical actions)
SHADOWDARK.nano_dizzyThreeTurns: Dizzy for 3 turns (-2 to physical actions)
SHADOWDARK.nano_dizzyOneMinute: Dizzy for a minute (-2 to physical actions)
SHADOWDARK.nano_stunnedOneTurn: Stunned for a turn (no action or move allowed)
SHADOWDARK.nano_stunnedThreeTurns: Stunned for 3 turns (no action or move allowed)
SHADOWDARK.nano_stunnedOneMinute: Stunned for a minute (no action or move allowed)
SHADOWDARK.nano_programLost: Cannot use the same program until a full rest.
SHADOWDARK.nano_chronicPain: Chronic Pain: Physical actions get a critical failure on a roll of 2 or 1.
SHADOWDARK.nano_hallucinations: Hallucinations: Mental actions get a critical failure on a roll of 2 or 1.
SHADOWDARK.nano_shiveringFever: Shivering Fever: Disadvantage on physical resistance checks.
SHADOWDARK.nano_dizziness: Dizziness: Disadvantage on mental resistance checks.
SHADOWDARK.nano_blinded: Blinded (disadvantage on all checks requiring vision)
SHADOWDARK.nano_oncePerWeek: Can only use this program for 1 day each week.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_spell.title: Britannian Spell
SHADOWDARK.britannian_spell.noSpellbook: You can't scribe spells without an equipped spellbook.
SHADOWDARK.britannian_spell.alreadySusta: You can't cast a sustained spell while already sustaining another spell.
